intro: Didissandra lancifolia, commonly known as the African moonseed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, greenish-white flowers. The plant produces distinctive, elongated fruits that contain several seeds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
